Message:
Liberia and I were different
in every respect
you could think of.
Our understanding of
the world, our values—
everything.

Because of that,
we clashed often at first.

But before long,
Liberia tried to bridge
the gap between us.

“I...want to know Ayse.
I want to know, because...
I do not know Ayse yet...!”

Ah... This girl has the power
to accept those who are
different from her.

Unlike me, who rejects them,
believing we won’t understand
each other anyway...

As a researcher, I may possess
more knowledge than her,

but she has a greater
understanding of what’s
truly important.

If I could become
more like her...
then we could be...

“I...want to know you, too...
Because...I want to
be your friend, Liberia.”

If we both try to bridge
the gap between us,
we can understand
one another.

At the time,
that’s what I believed,
but...

It turns out...
we should never
have met after all...
